info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 5:25PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 600 PM MST... At 525 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near White Tank Mountain Park, or 11 miles south of Wittmann. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Surprise, Buckeye, Surprise Stadium and White Tank Mountain Park. This includes AZ Route 303 between mile markers 113 and 117. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
